variant.title: Human Language Technology Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics Proceedings of the Student Research Workshop
variant.author: Ani Nenkova, Nicola Stokes, and Karen Livescu Student Workshop Co-chairs Lisa Ballesteros, Eric Fosler-Lussier, and Amanda Stent Faculty Advisors May 2-7, 2004
variant.bodyText: We are pleased to present the 10 papers accepted for presentation at the HLT/NAACL 2004 Student Workshop to be held in Boston on May 2. The main mission of the workshop is to provide feedback for students' work in progress. Each presentation will be followed by comments on the work from a panel of senior researchers. We thank the panelists in advance for their time and feedback. This year, we received 12 submissions representing 4 countries. We would like to thank all of the authors who submitted their work. We are very grateful to the program committee for the time and effort they put into reviewing the papers, and for their thoughtful feedback to the authors. We also thank the HLT/NAACL-2004 main conference organizers, especially Christy Doran, Miles Osborne, Katrin Kirchhoff, Pablo Duboue, Priscilla Rasmussen, and Julia Hirschberg. Several previous student co-chairs provided helpful words of wisdom, including Costas Boulis, Eric Breck, Victor Lavrenko, and Gideon Mann. We are extremely grateful to our faculty advisors, Lisa Ballesteros, Eric Fosler- Lussier, and Amanda Stent, for their generous guidance throughout the organizing process. Finally, we gratefully acknowledge the National Science Foundation, whose support will make it possible to provide financial assistance to the presenters.
variant.reference: Karen Livescu, Ani Nenkova, and Nicola Stokes ORGANIZERS: Co-Chairs. variant.abstract: We are pleased to present the 10 papers accepted for presentation at the HLT/NAACL 2004 Student Workshop to be held in Boston on May 2. The main mission of the workshop is to provide feedback for students' work in progress. Each presentation will be followed by comments on the work from a panel of senior researchers. We thank the panelists in advance for their time and feedback. This year, we received 12 submissions representing 4 countries. We would like to thank all of the authors who submitted their work. We are very grateful to the program committee for the time and effort they put into reviewing the papers, and for their thoughtful feedback to the authors. We also thank the HLT/NAACL-2004 main conference organizers, especially Christy Doran, Miles Osborne, Katrin Kirchhoff, Pablo Duboue, Priscilla Rasmussen, and Julia Hirschberg. Several previous student co-chairs provided helpful words of wisdom, including Costas Boulis, Eric Breck, Victor Lavrenko, and Gideon Mann. We are extremely grateful to our faculty advisors, Lisa Ballesteros, Eric Fosler- Lussier, and Amanda Stent, for their generous guidance throughout the organizing process. Finally, we gratefully acknowledge the National Science Foundation, whose support will make it possible to provide financial assistance to the presenters.
